intro: Eumachia frutescens, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are a food source for birds and other wildlife. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Eumachia frutescens has a complex life cycle that involves both parasitic and photosynthetic phases.
